headline: Wall Street Strategists React to Moody’s US Credit Rating Cut
summary: (Bloomberg) -- US stocks declined and Treasury yields rose after Moody’s Ratings downgraded the US credit rating, citing an increase in government debt and a higher interest burden.Most Read from BloombergAs Coastline Erodes, One California City Considers ‘Retreat Now’How a Highway Became San Francisco’s Newest ParkMaryland’s Credit Rating Gets Downgraded as Governor Blames Trump NJ Transit Train Engineers Strike, Disrupting Travel to NYCPower-Hungry Data Centers Are Warming Homes in the Nordics

headline: Wall Street Is Down on the Dollar as Trade Unease Lingers
summary: (Bloomberg) -- In a week that saw an epic rally in US stocks and recession calls cast aside, currency traders are just as bearish as ever on the American dollar.
